description:
**Problem**
Remote URL normalization is too loose (ssh/https variants, ports, users). This can split canonical state across clones and cause data divergence.

**Design**
Add a stricter RemoteUrl parser that:
- strips scheme/user, lowercases host
- normalizes ssh scp-style and ssh:// URLs
- preserves port when present (host:port)
- trims .git and trailing slashes
Add focused tests for common variants (ssh/https/ssh://, with/without user, with port).

**Acceptance**
- [ ] Same remote in different URL forms maps to identical RemoteUrl
- [ ] Tests cover common cases + edge cases
- [ ] No regressions for file:// or local paths

**Files:** src/daemon/remote.rs
title: Remote URL canonicalization + type tightening

description:
Document the migration path for users of the Go version to switch to Rust. Cover:

- Data format changes (if any)
- CLI differences
- New features in beads-rs
- How to migrate existing beads data

This helps adoption and shows the project is mature enough to replace the Go version.
title: Write migration guide for beads-go to beads-rs
